page.title: 07BIRDS,WILD ANIMALS & FLOWERS
page.content:
Here are some of the wild flowers we found growing nearby: {Red and White Campion, Sorrel, {Buttercups, Daisies, Dandelions, Cow {Parsley}and{Forget-me-nots.}
There are lots of rabbits and the occasional hedgehog to be seen. In addition to common birds such as sparrows,thrush,starlings,etc. , there can often be seen pheasants from Lord Derby's estate, as well as magpies and crows around the farms.In winter we can see flocks of geese flying above. Due to{Eccleston Mere}being very close there are also water birds to be seen such as ducks and herons,which are proving a menace to the fish ponds in neighbouring gardens. It has also been noticed that seagulls are seen more often around housing estates and school playgrounds
